p: Outside Asia, Ae. albopictus populations display highly variable success in invading the deep forest. In Brazil, where Ae. albopictus was observed for the first time in the 1980s, Pereira dos Santos et al. found that Ae. albopictus was able to enter degraded forest in the Manaus region, up to 750 metres from the edge [ 44]. In Gabon, where Ae. albopictus was first reported in 2007, it was captured 12 years later in the Lop√© natural forest, several kilometres from villages or clearings ( Paupy pers. com.).
